Line 114: Line 114:
== Availability of third-party software ==
== Availability of third-party software ==
â
{{See also|Linux distribution#Proprietary software|Medibuntu|Getdeb}}
+
{{See also|Linux distribution#Proprietary software|Medibuntu|Getdeb|Ubuntu extras remix}}
Ubuntu has a certification system for third party software.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ubuntu.com/partners/softwareprogramme | title=partners/certification/software | accessdate=2006-03-16|publisher=Canonical Ltd. }}</ref> Some third-party software that does not limit distribution is included in Ubuntu's multiverse component. The package ''ubuntu-restricted-extras'' additionally contains software that may be legally restricted, including support for [[MP3]] and [[DVD-Video|DVD]] playback, [[mscorefonts|Microsoft TrueType core fonts]], [[Sun Microsystems|Sun's]] [[Java Virtual Machine|Java runtime environment]], [[Adobe Systems|Adobe's]] [[Adobe Flash Player|Flash Player]] plugin, many common audio/video [[codec]]s, and unrar, an unarchiver for files [[data compression|compressed]] in the [[RAR (file format)|RAR file format]].
Ubuntu has a certification system for third party software.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ubuntu.com/partners/softwareprogramme | title=partners/certification/software | accessdate=2006-03-16|publisher=Canonical Ltd. }}</ref> Some third-party software that does not limit distribution is included in Ubuntu's multiverse component. The package ''ubuntu-restricted-extras'' additionally contains software that may be legally restricted, including support for [[MP3]] and [[DVD-Video|DVD]] playback, [[mscorefonts|Microsoft TrueType core fonts]], [[Sun Microsystems|Sun's]] [[Java Virtual Machine|Java runtime environment]], [[Adobe Systems|Adobe's]] [[Adobe Flash Player|Flash Player]] plugin, many common audio/video [[codec]]s, and unrar, an unarchiver for files [[data compression|compressed]] in the [[RAR (file format)|RAR file format]].
